group_1.textLeft: Did you get a good rest?

group_1.textRight: Yes, thanks to your hospitality.
Thank you for taking us in!

group_1.textLeft: Come back soon, Jeanette.
And bring your friends with you!
...Thank you, Jeanette.
I think she was fully convinced that you were her@granddaughter.

group_1.textRight: No, don't thank me...thank Liz!
I managed to pull it off without lying. All of our@stories were true.

group_1.textLeft: Well, I know she was very pleased.
We're sincerely grateful.

group_1.textRight: We're getting close to the village.

group_1.textLeft: I think we'll be there before dark!

group_1.textRight: This was quite a trip.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, at some points, I wasn't sure what would@happen next...
In the end, however, I helped my uncle and his wife@bring...
...their first child into the world, and start@a new family...
I'm so happy for them!

group_1.textRight: *Chuckle*

group_1.textLeft: We're back!
The birth went splendidly!

group_1.textRight: Oh, wow! That's great!
Liz! Now that you're back, please keep teaching me@how to use a sword!
I think I've gotten a bit better now!
I think you'd lose to her in a one-on-one fight, Tart.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, probably.

group_1.textRight: Oh, by the way, Mom's back from her pilgrimage,@too.
On her way to Rome, one family she stayed with...
...taught her how to make a lot of pasta dishes!
She said she'd make some for us once you came@home!

group_1.textLeft: Oh, how exciting!

group_1.textRight: If there's something specific you want, go ask Mom!

group_1.textLeft: I wonder if there's a pasta recipe that uses fish...?

group_1.textRight: Yes, there are.
I'm not sure if your mother would have been taught@any of them, however.

group_1.textLeft: Oh yeah, I remember...

group_1.textRight: That's right, I was born in Italy.

group_1.textLeft: So what are your favorite things to eat?

group_1.textRight: I like eating my pasta with honey.

group_1.textLeft: Wow...!
So that's the proper way to eat it, Liz!

group_1.textRight: No. It's an extremely uncommon method of@preparation.
From what I can tell,
the amount of honey that Liz douses on her pasta@is very much an outlier.

group_1.textLeft: Really?!
...Now that I think about it,
you're always carrying honey with you, right?

group_1.textRight: Yes... I'd be in a fair bit of trouble without it.

group_1.textLeft: You always looked so pleased when you eat@something sweet,
but I didn't realize you enjoyed it that much...

group_1.textRight: C'mon, let's go home already!

group_1.textLeft: Alright!

group_1.textCenter: Do you really put THAT much honey on it?!
